links.to_node: demand that my sister gives the dog up for adoption to a better home.
Your older sister may feel defensive and upset about your demand, leading to further arguments and tension within the family.
Your mother and younger sister may feel relieved that someone is finally taking a stand and addressing the issue with the dog's care and living conditions.
There may be a family discussion or intervention about the dog's well-being and the responsibilities of pet ownership, potentially leading to a resolution or compromise.
Your older sister may resist giving up the dog and instead make efforts to improve its care and training, potentially seeking professional help or rehoming the dog to a more suitable environment.

If your older sister agrees to give up the dog, there will be the process of finding a suitable new home or adoption organization, which may involve emotional goodbyes and adjustments for the family and the dog.
The dog may experience stress and confusion during the transition to a new home, but ultimately have the opportunity for a better quality of life with more attentive care and training.
